data.title: Smart Tourist Destination

data.text:
Salamanca is a university city like no other. Its university, one of the oldest in Europe, gives the city its open and diverse character.

Declared a World Heritage Site by UNESCO in 1988, the city lies on the banks of the river Tormes, bringing together an exceptional display of varying styles of universal art.

Salamanca spans a total area of 39 km2 and has a population of some 144,000 inhabitants.

The service sector is the main activity, especially cultural and language services, with tourism also falling within this sector.

In 2019, the regulated accommodation of Salamanca welcomed around 770,000 tourists. Counting also the 256,000 or so day-trip visitors, the destination received more than one million visitors over the course of the year. The estimated tourist expenditure for Salamanca exceeds 260 million euros per year.
